definition: cloth/to declare/to announce/to spread/to make known
to say/to tell/to announce/to report/to denounce/to file a lawsuit/to sue
fence/railing/hurdle/column or box (of text or other data)

sentences.chinese: 浏览网上自由译者布告栏。

sentences.english: She posted an advertisement seeking a house on the housing estate's bulletin board.
sentences.chinese: 她在小区的布告栏里贴出了求售房屋的广告。

sentences.english: The teacher pegged a notice to a notice board.
sentences.chinese: 老师把通知钉在布告栏上。

sentences.english: Angry workers tore the notice down from the noticeboard.
sentences.chinese: 愤怒的工人把布告栏上的通告撕了下来。

sentences.english: Please look at the notice board every day.
Do you see the new list of price on the notice-board ?
sentences.chinese: 你看到布告栏上新的价目表了吗？

sentences.english: The naughty boy tore down a notice from a notice board.
sentences.chinese: 那个顽皮的男孩撕下布告栏中的一张布告。

sentences.english: There were lots of notices on the notice-board.
Staff can use the noticeboard to flag up any concerns.
sentences.chinese: 员工可以用布告栏表达任何关注。

definition: blackboard bulletin with short news items written on it (can usually be found in factories, schools etc)
to log out (computer)/to publish/to be published/to appear (in a newspaper etc)
mail room/radio room (i.e. reception and transmission)
